column5: Agree that the problem is more serious than I would have imagined. I belong to some sites where the members make annual contributions to the administrator to keep the site going. If there is a money obstacle here to get the site up & running, maybe a solicitation of members would be helpful. With that said, I really don't have any idea as to what would be involved with "recreating" the site. Just sad how so much enjoyment has been taken away from so many and WHY!!!!
I know a few fishing websites that were hit by the same gang and all were on PHHB Platform without the latest security updates.They now to re-build the site.
Here is the latest on Fish-HawkFollowing quote taken from their site)Getting somewhere....hopefully soon....Cheers.Regards,Snowball
Fish-Hawk Message Board is BACK ON LINE!http://www.fish-hawk.net/ Regards,Snowball
I hope this question is not out of line on this site but does anyone know what happened to the Fish Hawk message board? I have been unable to access their site for the past couple of days.
Just checked, no luck here either.
Yeah, wonder what's up with the site. I haven't been able to access all week. But, no one else seems to be chiming in?
It's been a week now.Maybe they just pull the plug.
Did a search of Google and came up with the following:http://www.niagarafishing.net/forums...showtopic=1885 Regards, Snowball
Snowball -- wonder how we will know if & when the site is back up.? I'm thinking that my current bookmark will not work with the "new" site. Any thoughts?

I plan on monitoring their current link and also checking on Google. There is another site in Canada that has friends and miss Fish Hawk , I am sure they will be notifying their members upon Fish Hawks return. I will add a thread to Walleye Central , once I hear. Regards, Snowball

Hi guys.I have heard/read that F-H was hit hard by a virus. The Admin is rumored to be away (until the 28th) and will then have to rebuild. It could take time but I firmly believe it will get back online.Bunk
He has a message up now regarding the problem. Doesn't sound good!
